text: I built a kingdom out of plunder and persuasion. Let eyri choke on it.
Everything has a price — and I’m the one who sets it.
His tongue is silver, his purse is full, and his troll is always hungry.
He calls himself merchant, but his axes are redder than his ledgers.
Said to leave a trail of glittering coin upon the waves, this longship's hull is adorned with hammered gold filigree and gromril rivets. Rumour holds it sails faster when coin is near.
Loyalty is fine, but gold shines brighter.
One word from him and enemies lower their prices... or their guards.
If there’s profit in it, Eyri will find the way.
He dealt in lies and gold — and lost both.

Eyri Goldfinger’s infamous twin axes — Coincleavers — are as symbolic as they are deadly. Forged by a disgraced dwarf runesmith deep in the fjords of Norsca, the blades were once part of an unbreakable lockbox made to guard royal tithes. Eyri slew the smith, melted down the box, and reforged it into weapons that would "unlock" the riches of others.
A schemer, a trader, a raider — always with a coin in his hand and a dagger behind his back.

Eyri Goldfinger, self-styled Lord of Eyristaad, is as much a merchant as he is a raider — the distinction, to him, is simply one of formality. Though sworn to High King eyri Grondal as a loyal Bjornling, he operates on the fringe of loyalty, brokering deals across the Sea of Claws and skimming war profits with equal delight. His cunning tongue and quick blades have earned him both coin and contempt in equal measure.
Each swing seals a pact, each kill a debt repaid in red.

In Eyristaad, loyalty is bought, sold, and often bartered for salted fish. Goldfinger’s wealth has kept the trolls fed, the ships floating, and the blades sharpened. Some claim he’s struck secret pacts with foreign lords, or even daemons. Eyri denies it all — while sipping Bretonnian brandy and calculating interest on war.
From the icy caves beneath Mount Kronfjall, this mammoth was captured after ten men died luring it from its lair.
From the icy caves beneath Mount Kronfjall, this mammoth was captured after ten men died luring it from its lair.

This banner is stitched from coastal sailcloth dyed deep grey-blue, flecked with blood-rust and frayed by sea spray. Its sigil — a golden kraken clutching a balance scale — marks it unmistakably as the flag of Eyristaad and the Goldfinger fleet. To Eyri’s men, it is a symbol of opportunity. Where it flies, coin flows and enemies bleed. To his rivals, it is the promise of treachery — for this banner is raised not in honour or loyalty, but in pursuit of gain.
Goldfinger's retinue knows when to fight... and when to sail away richer.
Said to have trampled more merchants than hoarded treasure, this beast knows the scent of gold and blood alike.
Once a travelling merchant’s wagon, now converted into a blood-slick war chariot that rolls over both coin and corpses.
Said to have trampled more merchants than hoarded treasure, this beast knows the scent of gold and blood alike.
Once a travelling merchant’s wagon, now converted into a blood-slick war chariot that rolls over both coin and corpses.
Said to have trampled more merchants than hoarded treasure, this beast knows the scent of gold and blood alike.
Once a travelling merchant’s wagon, now converted into a blood-slick war chariot that rolls over both coin and corpses.
Grompf follows coin and blood. I give him both.
A coat lined with coins and contracts, blessed by no gods, yet proof against many blades.
I trade loyalty like fish. Fresh or rotten — I always make a profit.
“Gold for blood—slay well, and Eyri will see you paid in weight.”
A true son of the coast — fast, ruthless, and unrelenting.

In the shadow of Kronfjall’s lightning-crowned peak, where gold is weighed as heavily as blood, Eyri Goldfinger plots beneath a cloak of loyalty. A sworn vassal to High King Grondal in word alone, Eyri barters silver and secrets across the Sea of Claws, weaving coin into power while the High King sleeps. But the north burns—Icefang raiders, draped in frost and madness, descend upon Eyristaad’s borders with cold fury in their eyes. Between fire and frost, Eyri sharpens his twin axes, knowing one truth above all: loyalty is for fools, but wealth buys everything... even kingship.
A thick-skulled brute with a taste for grog and gore, Grompf follows Eyri Goldfinger out of habit... and hunger.

There are trolls, and then there is Grompf — a regenerating, battle-scarred beast who has served Eyri Goldfinger longer than most mercenaries keep their limbs. Towering over men and stinking of algae, Grompf is no ordinary lackey; he is a walking siege weapon, a living reminder of Eyri's recklessness and genius. 'Killed' more times than anyone cares to count, Grompf simply gets back up again, his flesh knitting back together with horrifying ease. Though utterly dim-witted, he has a primitive loyalty to Eyri, often dragging spoils — or prisoners — to his master like a slobbering hound.
His club carved from a sea beast’s jaw, perfect for smashing humans.

[[img:hkrul_goftur_ambition]][[/img]][[col:green]]Aid Gröftur on fulfilling his [[col:yellow]]Path to Glory[[/col]] and obtain the powerful gifts of [[col:yellow]]Mermedus[[/col]] and ascend as his[[col:yellow]] Avatar[[/col]].[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_nor_gods]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Raze settlements and raise monoliths in their place to gradually pledge[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_gods]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_gods}}]]Allegiance to the Gods[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], who will each grant factionwide gifts in lieu of the others.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_nor_monsters]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Hunt down creatures listed in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_monsters]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_monsters}}]]Monstrous Arcanum[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and defeat them in battle in return for unique and powerful trophies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Defeat the faction leaders of rival Norscan tribes to be given the option to form tribal[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_confederation]]confederations.[[/sl_link]]\\n\\nLearn more about Norsca [[url:script_link_campaign_norsca]]here[[/url]].

[[img:hkrul_grydal_ambition]][[/img]][[col:green]] Jarl Grydal may be set on a [[col:yellow]]Path to Glory[[/col]] and obtain the powerful gifts of [[col:yellow]]Khorne[[/col]] and ascend as his forefather[[col:yellow]] Urlfdaemonkin[[/col]].[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_nor_gods]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Raze settlements and raise monoliths in their place to gradually pledge[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_gods]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_gods}}]]Allegiance to the Gods[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], who will each grant factionwide gifts in lieu of the others.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_nor_monsters]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Hunt down creatures listed in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_monsters]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_monsters}}]]Monstrous Arcanum[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and defeat them in battle in return for unique and powerful trophies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Defeat the faction leaders of rival Norscan tribes to be given the option to form tribal[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_confederation]]confederations.[[/sl_link]]\\n\\nLearn more about Norsca [[url:script_link_campaign_norsca]]here[[/url]].

From the steep, storm-lashed slopes of Kronfjall, Eyri Goldfinger casts his gaze southward. His network of raiders, traders, and smugglers spreads like salt on the wind—seeping into coastal towns, choking trade routes, and buying loyalty where axes alone will not do. Though he speaks oaths to High King Grondal, Eyri builds an empire of coin and cunning, where longships carry timber one way and plunder the other. The Icefang grow restless in the north, and Grondal's suspicions fester—but opportunity lies ahead, and Eyri intends to seize it before either threat closes in.

Stitched from sailcloth soaked in brine and battle, this banner bears the golden kraken of Eyristaad clutching a balance scale—coin and axe held in equal weight. Salt-encrusted and fraying, it has flown above merchant convoys, sacked ports, and drowned fortresses alike. To Eyri’s allies, it is a promise of profit; to his enemies, a warning that diplomacy may yet come... before the fire. Wherever this standard rises, trade flows, treaties unravel, and someone always ends up paying the price.
A raider’s trust lies in coin, and Eyri never underpays a killer.
A tribute to broken oaths—worn on the ring and thumb, they tighten with greed.

Oathgeld & Thumbbite were once wedding rings of a long-dead merchant-lord, cursed to drive their bearer mad with hunger for wealth. Now, they empower Eyri with uncanny agility and a mind honed for deals, plunder, and swift betrayal.
A single, perfectly timed throw from a hidden blade — swift, silent, and sunk deep between the ribs.
A sudden flurry of razor-sharp daggers from beneath his cloak — more than enough to turn the tide.
